summary.span: A collection of objects stored in session state.

span.span: A collection of objects stored in session state.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类用于管理会话状态变量值编制索引的按变量名称或数字索引。The class is used to manage session-state variable values indexed by a variable name or by numerical index. 会话状态变量公开给 ASP.NET 应用程序代码使用类，该类使用访问属性的当前或。The session-state variables are exposed to ASP.NET application code using the class, which is accessed using the property of the current or the . 类调用类，该类管理使用的会话状态变量值。The class calls the class, which manages session-state variable values using the . ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建一个新对象并设置并按名称获取集合中的值。The following code example creates a new object and sets and gets values in the collection by name. [!code-csharp[System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemCollection/CS/keyscs.aspx#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemCollection/VB/keysvb.aspx#1)]

span.para: 当你创建基于自定义会话状态提供程序类，而使用类来管理存储在会话状态中的项。如果你需要创建用于管理会话状态项，而实现的自定义对象接口。

When you create a custom session-state provider based on the class, use the class to manage the items stored in session state. If you need to create a custom object to manage session-state items, implement the interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性用于指示是否的内容集合已更改。The property is used to indicate whether the contents of the collection have changed. 属性设置为`true`对象值的设置或添加到集合使用时属性并且当一个或多个对象值会从集合使用， ，或方法。The property is set to `true` when an object value is set or added to the collection using the property and when one or more object values are removed from the collection using the , , or methods. 属性也设置为`true`可变对象从集合中检索时属性。The property is also set to `true` when a mutable object is retrieved from the collection using the property. 调用方法来填充集合导致属性被设置为`false`。Calling the method to populate a collection results in the property being set to `false`.
